title: How to Cool a Hot Drink Quickly

steps.headline: Take your drink and pour it from one cup to the other cup.
steps.description: If your cup goes higher, then more air will go through it, making it colder. Don't make your cup go too high, after pouring, it might bounce a few drops and land on your arms. It will burn!

steps.headline: Repeat until your drink has cooled down.
Once it has cooled down, enjoy your drink.
Put one or two ice cubes in your hot drink.
Enjoy!
steps.description: The ice should have cooled down your drink.

steps.headline: Trying pouring some milk into your drink.
Get a fan, and aim the fan at your drink.
steps.description: The cool wind from the fan will cool down your drink.

steps.headline: If you do not have a fan, try blowing on your drink, but not too hard.
Blow across the surface of the drink.
steps.description: Form your lips into an "O" shape and gently blow a steady stream of air across the surface of your hot drink. The cool air will reduce the temperature at the surface of the water.

steps.headline: Stir your drink with a teaspoon.
steps.description: As you blow, continually stir the drink with a teaspoon. This allows a greater volume of the hot drink to be cooled by the air.

steps.headline: Continue until your drink reaches the desired temperature.
steps.description: Although you may feel a little silly doing it, the blowing and stirring method is actually one of the most effective ways to cool a hot drink. In fact, studies have shown that using this method can cool a hot drink by up to 11 degrees per minute!

steps.headline: Put the drink inside its cup into a closed container.
Put some ice sprinkled with salt into the closed container (not into the drink cup).
Let sit briefly.
steps.description: Your drink will be cold in a matter of minutes.

text: Transferring Between Cups Take your drink and pour it from one cup to the other cup. If your cup goes higher, then more air will go through it, making it colder. Don't make your cup go too high, after pouring, it might bounce a few drops and land on your arms. It will burn! Repeat until your drink has cooled down.  Once it has cooled down, enjoy your drink.  Ice Cubes Put one or two ice cubes in your hot drink.  Stir your drink.  Enjoy! The ice should have cooled down your drink. Milk Trying pouring some milk into your drink.  Stir well.  Fanning the Drink Get a fan, and aim the fan at your drink. The cool wind from the fan will cool down your drink. If you do not have a fan, try blowing on your drink, but not too hard.  Blowing and Stirring Blow across the surface of the drink. Form your lips into an "O" shape and gently blow a steady stream of air across the surface of your hot drink. The cool air will reduce the temperature at the surface of the water. Stir your drink with a teaspoon. As you blow, continually stir the drink with a teaspoon. This allows a greater volume of the hot drink to be cooled by the air. Continue until your drink reaches the desired temperature. Although you may feel a little silly doing it, the blowing and stirring method is actually one of the most effective ways to cool a hot drink. In fact, studies have shown that using this method can cool a hot drink by up to 11 degrees per minute! Ice and Salt Put the drink inside its cup into a closed container.  Put some ice sprinkled with salt into the closed container (not into the drink cup).  Let sit briefly. Your drink will be cold in a matter of minutes.
